snippet: As we’ve conquered prematurity, we have created a new difficulty: deciding whom to fight for and whom to let go of.
abstract: Dr Rahul K Parikh essay asserts that advances in the ability to care for premature babies in neonatal intensive care units raises complicated question of when to resuscitate an infant and when to let go; notes survivors of extreme prematurity often suffer severe complications during their time in the unit and throughout their lives.
lead_paragraph: As we’ve conquered prematurity, we have created a new difficulty: deciding whom to fight for and whom to let go of.

headline.seo: Better Care for Premature Babies Also Means Harder Choices
headline.main: In Preemies, Better Care Also Means Hard Choice
headline.print_headline: In Preemies, Better Care Also Means Hard Choice
